title: Phase 1: Extract UntetheredCore shared Swift package
description:
Create a Swift Package containing all platform-agnostic code that can be shared between iOS and macOS apps.

CONTEXT:
See design document: docs/macos-port-design.md (Section: Shared Code Package)

OBJECTIVE:
Extract business logic, models, networking, and persistence code from the iOS app into a reusable Swift Package without breaking the iOS app.

STRUCTURE TO CREATE:
Shared/
├── Package.swift
└── Sources/
    └── UntetheredCore/
        ├── Models/           # Message, Session, Command, Resource
        ├── Networking/       # VoiceCodeClient, WebSocketMessage
        ├── Managers/         # SessionSyncManager, Voice I/O, Resources
        ├── Persistence/      # PersistenceController, CoreData models
        ├── Settings/         # AppSettings
        └── Utilities/        # TextProcessor, GitBranchDetector

FILES TO MOVE (from ios/VoiceCode/):

Models/ - Move ALL:
- Models/Message.swift
- Models/Resource.swift
- Models/Command.swift
- Models/RecentSession.swift
- Models/CDBackendSession.swift (CoreData entity)
- Models/CDMessage.swift (CoreData entity)
- Models/CDUserSession.swift (CoreData entity)

Managers/ - Move SELECTED (platform-agnostic only):
- Managers/VoiceCodeClient.swift ✓
- Managers/SessionSyncManager.swift ✓
- Managers/VoiceInputManager.swift ✓
- Managers/VoiceOutputManager.swift ✓
- Managers/ResourcesManager.swift ✓
- Managers/ActiveSessionManager.swift ✓
- Managers/AppSettings.swift ✓
- Managers/PersistenceController.swift ✓

Managers/ - KEEP IN iOS (platform-specific):
- Managers/DeviceAudioSessionManager.swift (iOS audio session)
- Managers/NotificationManager.swift (iOS notifications)
- Managers/DraftManager.swift (iOS-specific UI state)
- Managers/LogManager.swift (could be shared but low priority)

Utilities/ - Move SELECTED:
- Utilities/TextProcessor.swift ✓ (platform-agnostic)
- Utils/GitBranchDetector.swift ✓ (platform-agnostic)

CoreData:
- VoiceCode.xcdatamodeld/ (entire directory)

FILES TO KEEP IN iOS:
- All Views/ (iOS-specific SwiftUI)
- ViewModels/ (iOS-specific)
- VoiceCodeApp.swift (iOS app entry point)
- Utils/RenderTracker.swift (iOS-specific debug)
- Utils/CommandSorter.swift (can stay, or move to Utilities/)

Add to packages section:


Update VoiceCode target dependencies:


STEPS:

1. Create Shared/ directory structure:
   - mkdir -p Shared/Sources/UntetheredCore/{Models,Networking,Managers,Persistence,Settings,Utilities}
   - mkdir -p Shared/Tests/UntetheredCoreTests

2. Create Package.swift with configuration above

3. Move files to Shared/Sources/UntetheredCore/:
   - Move Models/*.swift to Models/
   - Move selected Managers/*.swift to Managers/
   - Move Utilities/TextProcessor.swift, Utils/GitBranchDetector.swift to Utilities/
   - Move VoiceCode.xcdatamodeld to Persistence/
   - Move PersistenceController.swift to Persistence/

4. Update imports in moved files:
   - Remove UIKit imports (replace with Foundation)
   - Add 'import CoreData' where needed
   - Add 'import Speech' for VoiceInputManager
   - Add 'import AVFoundation' for VoiceOutputManager

5. Add platform conditionals where needed:
   - #if os(iOS) / #if os(macOS) for platform differences
   - Likely in VoiceInputManager, VoiceOutputManager
   - Check ResourcesManager for file path differences

6. Update project.yml:
   - Add UntetheredCore package
   - Add package dependency to VoiceCode target
   - Generate project: make generate-project

7. Update iOS app imports:
   - In all remaining iOS files, change:
     - Local imports → 'import UntetheredCore'
   - Example: Remove relative imports like '../Models/Message.swift'
   - Add: import UntetheredCore

8. Fix compilation errors:
   - Build iOS target
   - Fix any import errors
   - Fix any access control issues (add 'public' where needed)
   - Fix any missing dependencies

9. Update CoreData model loading:
   - Ensure PersistenceController loads .xcdatamodeld from bundle
   - May need to specify bundle: Bundle.module

10. Run iOS tests:
    - Run full iOS test suite
    - Fix any test failures
    - Ensure 100% pass rate

COMMON ISSUES TO WATCH:

1. **Access Control**: Swift Package members default to 'internal'
   - Add 'public' to classes, structs, methods used by iOS app
   - Add 'public' initializers

2. **Bundle Resources**: CoreData model needs Bundle.module
   - Old: Bundle.main
   - New: Bundle.module (for Swift Package)

3. **UIKit Dependencies**: Remove all UIKit imports
   - If needed, use #if canImport(UIKit)
   - Prefer Foundation-only code

4. **File Paths**: App Group paths, document directories
   - May differ between iOS/macOS
   - Use #if os(iOS) / #if os(macOS)

5. **Notifications**: NotificationCenter names
   - Keep platform-specific in iOS
   - Share only truly cross-platform logic

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA:
- [ ] Swift Package created in Shared/ directory
- [ ] Package.swift configured with iOS/macOS platforms
- [ ] All platform-agnostic code moved to UntetheredCore
- [ ] All moved files have proper 'public' access control
- [ ] iOS app imports UntetheredCore successfully
- [ ] iOS app builds without errors
- [ ] iOS app runs on simulator/device
- [ ] All iOS tests pass (100%)
- [ ] No behavioral changes (app works identically)
- [ ] CoreData model loads from package bundle
- [ ] Git commit: 'Extract UntetheredCore shared package'

5. Receive response (tests VoiceCodeClient, Message models)

8. Upload resource file (tests ResourcesManager, Resource models)
9. Switch sessions (tests ActiveSessionManager)
10. View settings (tests AppSettings)
11. Quit and relaunch (tests PersistenceController, CoreData)
12. All functionality must work identically to before

- ModelTests.swift (tests Message, Command, Resource models)
- AppSettingsTests.swift (tests AppSettings)
- VoiceCodeClientLifecycleTests.swift (tests VoiceCodeClient)

- VoiceOutputManagerTests.swift (tests VoiceOutputManager)
- TextProcessorTests.swift (tests TextProcessor)

title: Phase 5: Add macOS-specific features and polish
description:
Implement macOS-native features including keyboard shortcuts, menu bar, Settings window, drag-and-drop file uploads, and command execution UI.

CONTEXT:
See design document: docs/macos-port-design.md (Sections: macOS-Specific Features, Keyboard Shortcuts, Settings)
Depends on: Phase 4 (voice I/O must work)

OBJECTIVE:
Add macOS-specific features that differentiate the platform from iOS and provide a native macOS experience.

KEYBOARD SHORTCUTS TO IMPLEMENT:

Global:
- Cmd+N: New session
- Cmd+W: Close window
- Cmd+,: Open Preferences
- Cmd+Q: Quit app
- Cmd+M: Minimize window

Conversation:
- Cmd+Enter: Send message
- Space (hold): Push-to-talk
- Escape: Cancel recording/input
- Cmd+.: Stop current turn
- Cmd+K: Open commands menu
- Cmd+Shift+C: Copy session ID
- Cmd+Shift+V: Toggle auto-voice-input
- Cmd+Shift+S: Stop speaking
- Cmd+Shift+R: Replay last message

Navigation:
- Cmd+1: Focus sidebar
- Cmd+2: Focus session list
- Cmd+3: Focus conversation
- Cmd+[: Previous session
- Cmd+]: Next session
- Cmd+F: Focus search field

Implementation:
- Create MenuBarCommands.swift with CommandGroup definitions
- Add .keyboardShortcut() modifiers to relevant buttons
- Add .commands() modifier to WindowGroup in UntetheredMac.swift

title: Phase 6: Polish, testing, and production readiness
description:
Final polish, comprehensive testing, bug fixes, and preparation for v1.0 release to TestFlight.

CONTEXT:
See design document: docs/macos-port-design.md (Section: Phase 6, Testing Strategy, Success Criteria)
Depends on: Phase 5 (all features must be implemented)

OBJECTIVE:
Polish the macOS app to production quality, test comprehensively, fix all critical bugs, and prepare for TestFlight release.

POLISH TASKS:

1. App Icon and Assets:
   - Design macOS app icon (1024x1024)
   - Add to Assets.xcassets with all required sizes
   - Create launch screen (if applicable)
   - Add document icons (for file types, future)

2. Error Handling:
   - User-facing error messages for all failure cases
   - Alert dialogs with clear messaging
   - Retry mechanisms for network failures
   - Graceful degradation (offline mode)

3. Loading States:
   - Skeleton views while loading
   - Progress indicators for long operations
   - Shimmer effects for loading lists
   - Disable buttons during processing

4. Empty States:
   - Empty directory list: 'Add a directory to get started'
   - Empty session list: 'Create a new session'
   - Empty conversation: 'Send a message to Claude'
   - Empty resources: 'Drag files here to upload'
   - Empty command history: 'No commands executed yet'

5. User Feedback:
   - Toast notifications for actions (file uploaded, session deleted)
   - Confirmation dialogs for destructive actions
   - Success/error badges
   - Undo for accidental deletions (future)

6. Performance Optimization:
   - Profile with Instruments (Time Profiler)
   - Optimize CoreData fetch requests
   - Lazy loading for large message lists
   - Image caching for file thumbnails
   - Debounce search/filter inputs

7. Visual Polish:
   - Consistent spacing and alignment
   - Proper font hierarchy (titles, body, captions)
   - Color scheme (light/dark mode support)
   - Smooth animations and transitions
   - Hover states for interactive elements

UNIT TESTS TO WRITE:

UntetheredCore Package:
- [ ] Model encoding/decoding (Message, Session, Command, Resource)
- [ ] VoiceCodeClient message serialization (snake_case ↔ camelCase)
- [ ] VoiceCodeClient connection lifecycle (connect, disconnect, reconnect)
- [ ] SessionSyncManager session parsing from .jsonl
- [ ] AppSettings persistence (get/set values)
- [ ] ResourcesManager file validation (size limits, file types)

macOS App:
- [ ] Keyboard shortcut handling (verify actions called)
- [ ] File drop validation (valid/invalid file types)
- [ ] Menu bar command routing
- [ ] Settings view model logic (if MVVM)
- [ ] Directory selection state management
- [ ] Session selection state management

Target: 80%+ code coverage for business logic

INTEGRATION TESTS TO WRITE:

Backend Communication:
- [ ] WebSocket connection lifecycle (connect → hello → connect → connected)
- [ ] Send prompt → receive response flow
- [ ] Session lock state management (optimistic lock → turn_complete)
- [ ] Command execution (execute_command → command_started → output → complete)
- [ ] File upload (upload_file → file_uploaded)
- [ ] Session compaction (compact_session → compaction_complete)

CoreData:
- [ ] Session CRUD (create, read, update, delete)
- [ ] Message CRUD with relationships
- [ ] Fetch request filtering (by directory, by session)
- [ ] Concurrent access safety (multiple write operations)
- [ ] Migration (if schema changes)

Voice:
- [ ] Speech recognition flow (mock SFSpeechRecognizer)
- [ ] TTS playback flow (mock AVSpeechSynthesizer)
- [ ] Permission handling (granted, denied, restricted)

Target: All critical user flows covered

BUG FIXES:

Process:
1. Collect all bugs from manual testing
2. Create individual beads issues for each bug
3. Prioritize: P0 (blocking), P1 (high), P2 (medium), P3 (low)
4. Fix all P0 and P1 bugs before release
5. Document P2/P3 bugs for future releases

Expected Bug Categories:
- UI layout issues (alignment, spacing)
- Edge case crashes (nil dereference, index out of bounds)
- Performance issues (slow rendering, memory leaks)
- Network edge cases (timeout, malformed messages)
- CoreData issues (fetch request errors, relationship issues)
- Voice issues (permission handling, audio glitches)

title: macOS Desktop Port - Epic
description:
Port the Untethered iOS app to macOS with maximum code reuse and native macOS experience.

PROJECT OVERVIEW:
This epic tracks the complete port of the Untethered voice-controlled Claude Code interface from iOS to macOS. The project maximizes code reuse through a shared Swift Package (UntetheredCore) while embracing macOS-native patterns and conventions.

DESIGN DOCUMENT:
See docs/macos-port-design.md for comprehensive architectural design, implementation strategy, and technical specifications.

TECHNOLOGY DECISIONS:
- UI Framework: SwiftUI for macOS (maximum code reuse)
- Persistence: CoreData (shared models with iOS)
- Voice I/O: Speech Framework + AVFoundation (same as iOS)
- Build System: XcodeGen (extend existing project.yml)
- Backend: No changes needed (platform-agnostic Clojure WebSocket server)

PROJECT STRUCTURE:
voice-code-desktop/
├── backend/          # Unchanged - platform agnostic
├── ios/              # Existing iOS app
├── macos/            # New macOS app
└── Shared/           # UntetheredCore Swift Package (shared code)

IMPLEMENTATION PHASES:

Phase 1: Extract UntetheredCore Shared Package
- Move platform-agnostic code to Swift Package
- Models, networking, managers, persistence
- Validate iOS app still works
- Issue: voice-code-desktop-0z7

Phase 2: Create Minimal macOS App
- Basic macOS target with WebSocket connectivity
- Prove communication layer works
- Simple text-based UI
- Issue: voice-code-desktop-8h4

Phase 3: Implement Core UI
- NavigationSplitView (3-column layout)
- DirectoryListView, SessionListView, ConversationView
- CoreData persistence integration
- Session sync from backend
- Issue: voice-code-desktop-tkh

Phase 4: Add Voice I/O
- Speech-to-text via Speech Framework
- Text-to-speech via AVSpeechSynthesizer
- Push-to-talk (Space bar, mic button)
- Auto-play and manual replay
- Issue: voice-code-desktop-64n

Phase 5: macOS-Specific Features
- Keyboard shortcuts (Cmd+Enter, Cmd+K, etc.)
- Menu bar integration (File, Edit, View, Session, etc.)
- Settings window (Cmd+,)
- Drag-and-drop file upload
- Command execution UI
- Issue: voice-code-desktop-49h

Phase 6: Polish and Testing
- App icon and visual polish
- Comprehensive testing (unit, integration, manual)
- Bug fixes
- TestFlight preparation
- Issue: voice-code-desktop-5zo

GOALS:
- 70-80% code reuse between iOS and macOS
- Native macOS experience (not just iOS app on Mac)
- Feature parity with iOS
- Production-ready v1.0 release to TestFlight

NON-GOALS:
- Cross-platform (Windows, Linux) in this iteration
- Mac Catalyst (native macOS target instead)
- iPad version (separate effort)

KEY FEATURES:
- 3-column NavigationSplitView layout
- Full keyboard shortcut support
- Menu bar integration
- Voice input (push-to-talk with Space bar)
- Voice output (auto-play, manual replay)
- Drag-and-drop file uploads
- Command execution (Makefile targets, git)
- Session management with CoreData persistence
- Real-time WebSocket sync with backend
- Settings window (server URL, voice settings, system prompt)

- All core iOS features work on macOS
- All macOS-specific features implemented
